name: Clover dev
com:
I still have to do the pending release, but I didn't have time for it last weekend. The sd card issues *need* to be solved and I need to add a top/bottom button.

About future development, it's a tough choice. Clover is a very fun project for me, but as long as it's not on the Play Store not a lot of people download it or know about it. That and I don't have any statistics of how many people download it from f-droid and I don't know about any crashes. (I don't want to implement botnet solutions for that). No reviews or user feedback through f-droid either.

I was working on imageboard software myself ( https://github.com/Floens/uchan ) and still want to make Clover multi site and make it compatible with it. I won't abandon it and I will update Clover when there are any issues with new Android versions, but don't expect a lot of new development from me. It's just that I don't get back what I put into it. Take a look how much code Clover actually is, it's a lot. I barely receive donations. The only thing that would spike development again is putting it back on the Play Store, and they'll probably ban me if I do.

I want to work on another app that has a wider audience than Clover. I've learned a lot about Android development from Clover and I want to put that to good use in something else. I don't want to be so dependent on external services. And I don't want something that's risky for the store rules.

So again, not abandoning it, I'll tag a new release when I get the current issues fixed, and multi site will come if I want to keep working on Âµchan, but that's about it.
